pull.title: build: enable libc++ and libstdc++ hardening
pull.body:
Enable the hardening of libc++ and libstdc++.

Inspired by https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31272#issuecomment-2518700939

events.message:
build: enable libc++ and libstdc++ hardening

Inspired by
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31272#issuecomment-2518700939

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -459,6 +459,12 @@ try_append_cxx_flags("-fstack-reuse=none" TARGET core_interface)
 if(ENABLE_HARDENING)
   add_library(hardening_interface INTERFACE)
   target_link_libraries(core_interface INTERFACE hardening_interface)
+
+  target_compile_options(hardening_interface INTERFACE
+    -D_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE=_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE_DEBUG
+    -D_GLIBCXX_ASSERTIONS
+  )
comments.body: Should this be set to `_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE_FAST` or `_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE_DEBUG` based on the build type?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -459,6 +459,12 @@ try_append_cxx_flags("-fstack-reuse=none" TARGET core_interface)
 if(ENABLE_HARDENING)

   target_link_libraries(core_interface INTERFACE hardening_interface)
+
+  target_compile_options(hardening_interface INTERFACE
+    -D_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE=_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE_DEBUG

comments.body:
How is this related to the following?

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/e8cc790fe2a223cfaa6dedfba88a6dc4f336f1d9/depends/hosts/linux.mk#L16-L20

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -459,6 +459,12 @@ try_append_cxx_flags("-fstack-reuse=none" TARGET core_interface)
 if(ENABLE_HARDENING)
   add_library(hardening_interface INTERFACE)
   target_link_libraries(core_interface INTERFACE hardening_interface)
+
+  target_compile_options(hardening_interface INTERFACE
+    -D_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE=_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE_DEBUG
+    -D_GLIBCXX_ASSERTIONS
+  )
+
comments.body: These are flags set for `DEBUG=1` when building depends. Iirc `-D_GLIBCXX_DEBUG` includes `-D_GLIBCXX_ASSERTIONS` as well as other slower checks.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -459,6 +459,12 @@ try_append_cxx_flags("-fstack-reuse=none" TARGET core_interface)
 if(ENABLE_HARDENING)
   add_library(hardening_interface INTERFACE)
   target_link_libraries(core_interface INTERFACE hardening_interface)
+
+  target_compile_options(hardening_interface INTERFACE
comments.body: Maybe we should add this to depends instead?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -459,6 +459,12 @@ try_append_cxx_flags("-fstack-reuse=none" TARGET core_interface)
 if(ENABLE_HARDENING)
   add_library(hardening_interface INTERFACE)
   target_link_libraries(core_interface INTERFACE hardening_interface)
+
+  target_compile_options(hardening_interface INTERFACE
+    -D_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE=_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE_DEBUG
+    -D_GLIBCXX_ASSERTIONS
+  )
+
comments.body:
How do they interact? According to https://libcxx.llvm.org/Hardening.html#notes-for-users only *one* is allowed to be passed.

I don't think it is useful to possibly silently downgrade `DEBUG` into `FAST`.

Also, it can be considered to enable the ABI checks in debug depends builds, see https://libcxx.llvm.org/Hardening.html#abi-options

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -512,6 +512,41 @@ if(ENABLE_HARDENING)
     if(CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME STREQUAL "Darwin")
       try_append_linker_flag("-Wl,-fixup_chains" TARGET hardening_interface)
     endif()
+
+    if(HAVE_LIBCPP)
+      # https://libcxx.llvm.org/Hardening.html
+      if(CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE STREQUAL "Debug")
+        target_compile_options(hardening_interface INTERFACE
+          -D_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE=_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE_DEBUG
+          -D_LIBCPP_ABI_BOUNDED_ITERATORS
+          -D_LIBCPP_ABI_BOUNDED_ITERATORS_IN_STRING
+          -D_LIBCPP_ABI_BOUNDED_ITERATORS_IN_VECTOR
+          -D_LIBCPP_ABI_BOUNDED_UNIQUE_PTR
+          -D_LIBCPP_ABI_BOUNDED_ITERATORS_IN_STD_ARRAY
comments.body: Have you tested this? I expect it to break the ABI for at least bdb?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -459,6 +459,12 @@ try_append_cxx_flags("-fstack-reuse=none" TARGET core_interface)
 if(ENABLE_HARDENING)
   add_library(hardening_interface INTERFACE)
   target_link_libraries(core_interface INTERFACE hardening_interface)
+
+  target_compile_options(hardening_interface INTERFACE
+    -D_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE=_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE_DEBUG
+    -D_GLIBCXX_ASSERTIONS
+  )

@@ -459,6 +459,12 @@ try_append_cxx_flags("-fstack-reuse=none" TARGET core_interface)
 if(ENABLE_HARDENING)
   add_library(hardening_interface INTERFACE)
   target_link_libraries(core_interface INTERFACE hardening_interface)
+
+  target_compile_options(hardening_interface INTERFACE
+    -D_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE=_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE_DEBUG
+    -D_GLIBCXX_ASSERTIONS
+  )
+
comments.body:
> How is this related to the following?

I understand that the flags in `bitcoin/depends/hosts/linux.mk` are (obviously) only used when building depends and only on Linux. In comparison, if added to `CMakeLists.txt` under `ENABLE_HARDENING` then the flags will be used for depends and for non-depends builds on all platforms that use libc++ or libstdc++, not only Linux. Thus I dropped the flags from `bitcoin/depends/hosts/linux.mk` and added (a more extensive) hardening to `CMakeLists.txt`.

Yes, `-D_GLIBCXX_DEBUG` includes `-D_GLIBCXX_ASSERTIONS`.

> How do they interact?

I guess it is harmless to specify both `_GLIBCXX_DEBUG*` and `_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE` because libstdc++ will honor the first and libc++ the second. 

> I don't think it is useful to possibly silently downgrade DEBUG into FAST.

Indeed that would be bad. If `_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE` is provided more than once on the command line, then a warning will be raised: "macro is redefined". E.g. `-D_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE=_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE_DEBUG -D_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE=_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE_FAST` will produce a warning.

> Also, it can be considered to enable the ABI checks

Done.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -459,6 +459,12 @@ try_append_cxx_flags("-fstack-reuse=none" TARGET core_interface)
 if(ENABLE_HARDENING)
   add_library(hardening_interface INTERFACE)
   target_link_libraries(core_interface INTERFACE hardening_interface)
+
+  target_compile_options(hardening_interface INTERFACE
comments.body: By default hardening is enabled in the CMake config and the depends build will benefit from that. Only if depends build uses `make NO_HARDEN=1` then it will disable the hardening in CMake.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -512,6 +512,41 @@ if(ENABLE_HARDENING)
     if(CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME STREQUAL "Darwin")
       try_append_linker_flag("-Wl,-fixup_chains" TARGET hardening_interface)
     endif()
+
+    if(HAVE_LIBCPP)
+      # https://libcxx.llvm.org/Hardening.html
+      if(CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE STREQUAL "Debug")
+        target_compile_options(hardening_interface INTERFACE
+          -D_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE=_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE_DEBUG
+          -D_LIBCPP_ABI_BOUNDED_ITERATORS
+          -D_LIBCPP_ABI_BOUNDED_ITERATORS_IN_STRING
+          -D_LIBCPP_ABI_BOUNDED_ITERATORS_IN_VECTOR
+          -D_LIBCPP_ABI_BOUNDED_UNIQUE_PTR
+          -D_LIBCPP_ABI_BOUNDED_ITERATORS_IN_STD_ARRAY
comments.body: Not manually, but I assume CI will fail if that happens. If it fails, then I will remove it.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -459,6 +459,12 @@ try_append_cxx_flags("-fstack-reuse=none" TARGET core_interface)
 if(ENABLE_HARDENING)
   add_library(hardening_interface INTERFACE)
   target_link_libraries(core_interface INTERFACE hardening_interface)
+
+  target_compile_options(hardening_interface INTERFACE
+    -D_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE=_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE_DEBUG
+    -D_GLIBCXX_ASSERTIONS
+  )
+
comments.body:
> I don't think it is useful to possibly silently downgrade DEBUG into FAST.

> If _LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE is provided more than once on the command line, then a warning will be raised

Just printing a warning will more than likely still result in silent downgrading.
